description: These may not be the Great Plains, but you can still be the Boss with this high-crowned, wide-brimmed hat.
A type of sun hat with a lightweight build and a wide brim that helps keep the sun out of your eyes, face, neck and shoulders.
A type of sun hat with a flat, circular crown and an oversized brim that extends outward from the head, creating a striking silhouette.
A cotton bandana, worn over the head.

use_action.msg: You adjust the %s to cover your mouth.

description: A synthetic fabric neckwarmer, worn over the head.

use_action.msg: You adjust the %s to cover your mouth and neck.

description: A soft cotton hat.  Commonly worn by armed forces and existentialists.
A soft wool hat.  Commonly worn by armed forces and existentialists.
The base item for the plumber's cap several variants.  It is a error if you found it naturally.

variants.description: A soft red cap featuring a white circle in the center, with a prominent red “M” in the middle.  It shields your face from the sun.
A soft green cap featuring a white circle in the center, with a prominent green “L” in the middle.  It shields your face from the sun.
A soft yellow cap featuring a somewhat small white circle in the center, with a prominent navy blue “W” in the middle that oversizes the circle.  It shields your face from the sun.
A soft purple cap featuring a white circle in the center, with a prominent yellow “Γ” in the middle.  It shields your face from the sun.

description: The only hat for a made man.  Look like a real good fella while laughing in the face of your foes!
A small, decorative headpiece comprised of a modest, practically invisible headband and a small black hat adorned with false feathers or plastic flowers.

A characteristic hat made of wool, with a checkered pattern and earflaps that can be tied on top of the hat or left hanging down.  The best hat, for the best of the post-apocalypse deer stalkers, or detectives.
A wreath headdress made from plant material woven into a ring.
Whether yer hunting varmints, fixing up the ranch, or heading into the sunset, this is the hat for the job.

variants.description: Whether yer hunting varmints, fixing up the ranch, or heading into the sunset, this is the hat for the job.
This hat has traded its original classic looks for a red, white, and blue pattern with a band of golden stars embossed about its lip; suitable headwear for only the most serious of patriots.

description: An improvised harness that can be worn over other headgear or by itself, made from two small liquid containers, a rubber hose, a bundle of steel wire, and some cordage.  A convenient and simple device for hands-free drinking, though it's not watertight and would spill if you put it into your backpack.
A high, black cap with a very narrow top.  Traditionally worn by Shinto priests.
A red, brimless, flat-topped headwear with a tassel on top.  Historically wore by various cultures and organizations thought history.

Also known as a utility cover or utility cap, this is an eight pointed hat with a baseball-style visor at the front.  Commonly worn by Marines and sailors, this hat is the standard headwear of both the United States Marine Corps and Navy.
A simple round cap in a camouflage pattern.  Often used by the military when helmets aren't needed.  Its brim helps keep the sun out of your eyes.
Also called a "bucket hat." Often used in the military.  Its wide brim helps keep the sun out of your eyes.
A typical bell-shaped hat usually wore by women (specially elderly ladies).  It is decorated with a pretty ribbon.
A civilian, commercial-grade bucket hat.  Comfortable and somewhat stylish, it will keep the sun out of your eyes.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A leather cap with a rounded crown, an adjustable strap, and a long visor.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth, while also providing more protection from environmental cuts and scratches than its cloth counterpart.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A crownless hat consisting simply of a visor with a adjustable strap encircling the head.  The top of the head is not covered and the visor protects the face, including eyes, nose, and cheeks, from the sun.  Popular amongst tennis players and joggers because it is very fresh, perfect to use in the summer!

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A crownless hat consisting simply of a leather visor with a adjustable leather strap encircling the head.  The top of the head is not covered and the visor protects the face, including eyes, nose, and cheeks, from the sun and potential scratches.  Great to use in the summer.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  The trucker hat came about in it's true form in the early 1970's as a promotional give-away from US feed or farming supply companies to farmers, truck drivers (hence the name) and other rural workers.  It is perfect for keeping your head cool and the sun out of your eyes.

variants.description: A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.

A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  It has the icon of a glass full of beer at the front, and a text in a funny font that reads: 'Beer is my diesel' besides it.

A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  It has the icon of a truck, apparently a Ford F of some series, at the front, alongside the flag of the United States of America and a text that reads: 'Proud to be a Trucker'.  It is more than a cap, it is a symbol of the love and the respect for the people that once spent their lives on the road, so other people could live at comfort with all the goods they transported from great distances.

A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  It is printed with the pattern of the flag of the United States of America.  Makes you feel like a patriot

A cotton cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  It is embossed with the pattern of the flag of the (now extinct) Empire of Brazil.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.  Probably owned by a Brazilian Monarchist.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular baseball team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular football team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular soccer team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular dodgeball team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular rugby team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular tennis team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular lacrosse team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular flatball team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a local golf club.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a local snooker, pool and billiards club.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a local foosball club.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback trucker cap displaying the logo of a popular westling rooster.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A leather cap with a broad front and a plastic mesh at the back, allowing better air circulation.  It is perfect for keeping your head cool, protected from scratches and the sun out of your eyes.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A cotton cap with a rounded crown, an adjustable strap, and a long visor, with pieces of plastic attached or sewed to it.  While it is not exactly beautiful, it protects your head even more now that it is reinforced with plastic.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A cotton cap with a rounded crown, an adjustable strap, and a long visor, with small sheets of scrap metal attached or glued to it.  It is not exactly beautiful, but it protects your head even more now that it is reinforced with metal.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: A cotton cap with a rounded crown, an adjustable strap, and a long visor.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.  Traditionally worn by baseball players.

variants.description: A cotton cap with a rounded crown, an adjustable strap, and a long visor.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.  Traditionally worn by baseball players.
A snapback golden-coloured baseball cap displaying a golden dollar sign symbol at the front.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.  Makes you fell like a rapper.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the shape of a single pine tree at the front.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the shape of two pine trees at the front, with the sun right above them.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the shape of three pine trees at the front, with the full moon (or the sun) right above them.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the phrase 'Got Sorcery?', coloured white in a cosmos black background.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the white-coloured shape of a diamond in the front.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the image of bloodpack connected to a drop of blood in the front, and under that image, a text that reads: 'Donating Blood', in white, and 'Save Lifes' in red.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the white-coloured icon of a pistol, apparently a SIG Sauer P320 or any other like it, with a text besides it.  It reads: 'SIG Sauer, when it counts'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A beige coloured snapback baseball cap displaying the FEMA acronym, which denotes for the Federal Emergency Management Agency, in the front, and the official seal of the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the right side.  Commonly used by the government organization employees and volunteers.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the detailed image of a round Planet Earth right at the front.  The whole cap is black, with some white dots around, making the background looks like outer space.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the image of a flat, disk-like Earth, with the dome right above it, showing the sun illuminating one half of Flat Earth, and the moon, illuminating the night with moonlight (which is reflected light from the sun) on the other half, and besides it, a text that reads: 'Earth is Flat!'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the green icon of a leaf in the front, and a text on the top of it reading 'Go Vegan!'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the pinkish icon of a slice of bacon in the front, and a text on the top of it reading 'Bacon is Life!'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the green icon of the well known symbol of biohazard and biological danger in the front, and a text reading 'Warning: Biohazard'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the yellow icon of the well known symbol of radioactive danger, the trefoil, in the front, and a text reading 'Warning: Radioactive'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap displaying the blue icon of the well known symbol of the atom, a particle of matter that uniquely defines a chemical element in the front, and a text reading 'Warning: Atomic Activity'.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

A snapback baseball cap embossed with the pattern of the flag of the United States of America.  It shields your eyes from the sun, provides a little bit of warmth and also makes you feel like a real patriot.
A snapback baseball cap displaying the logo of a popular soccer team.  It shields your eyes from the sun and provides a little bit of warmth.

description: A colorful cap with a brim and a plastic propeller on top.  It shields your eyes from the sun and make you look goofy.
A traditional chef's hat, standing tall and proud against the vulgarities of the world.

variants.description: It's colored white.
It's colored black.
It's a royal blue color.
It's colored red.
It's colored pink.
It's colored yellow.
It has camouflage dye.

description: A snug-fitting cotton hat.  Quite warm.
A comfortable, snug-fitting beanie hat.  Quite warm.
A hat made from the pelts of animals.  Extremely warm.

A conical hat typically made of bamboo, of asian origin.  It can be either a piece of a costume, a decorative item, something you'd find inside a dojo, etc.  This is the base item, it is a error if you found it naturally.

variants.description: A conical hat made of bamboo strips, with a wide brim, providing protection from the sun and rain, a pointed top and a chin strap to secure it in place.  Commonly worn by farmers and field workers in rural areas of China, but can be also part of a costume headgear, decorative item and etc.

A conical hat made of bamboo strips, with a wide brim and a round top.  Often worn as part of traditional Korean attire, particularly by scholars and noblemen during the Joseon Dynasty, but can be also part of a costume headgear, decorative item and etc.

A somewhat conical hat made of bamboo strips and straw, with a wide brim and a squarish top.  Commonly worn by farmers and laborers in rural areas of Thailand, but can be also part of a costume headgear, decorative item and etc.

A conical hat made of bamboo strips, with a wide brim that tapers to a point at the top.  Often worn by farmers and workers in Vietnam to shield them from the sun and rain.  The non la is also considered a symbol of Vietnamese culture and tradition, but can be also part of a costume headgear, decorative item and etc.
A conical hat made of bamboo strips, with a a broad, flat brim and a rounded crown.  Typically wore by Japanese rice farmers, but can be also part of a costume headgear, decorative item and etc.

description: A typically Russian hat made from the pelts of animals with earflaps.  Extremely warm to endure the Siberian Winter.
A comfortable hat made of the pelt of a raccoon, with a distinctive black and white fur pattern.  It has the tail hanging loose.
A historically luxurious hat with a tall, rounded crown and no brim, originally from Russia.
A stylish hat made of faux fur.  Like real fur, but without the suffering, if the tag is to be believed.  Very warm.
A ushanka made of faux fur, a typically Russian headgear with a nice pair of earflaps.  Like real fur, but without the suffering.  Very warm to endure the Russian Winter.
A coonskin hat made of faux fur.  Like real racoon fur, but without the suffering.  Very warm and has the tail hanging loose.
A historically luxurious hat with a tall, rounded crown and no brim, originally from Russia, but made with fauxfur.  Like real fur, but without the suffering.
A hard plastic hat worn at construction and industrial sites.  Provides excellent protection from cuts and percussion.

pocket_data.description: Pocket for a face shield or a shield visor.
Pocket for a strapped mandible guard.

variants.description: It's colored yellow, commonly used by general, unspecialized workers like laborers and operators of heavy machinery.
It's colored orange, commonly used by road construction workers, new hires, and site visitors.
It's colored white, commonly used by anyone in a supervisory position, including managers, architects, engineers, and foremen.
It's colored brown, commonly used by workers using applications involving high heat such as welders.
It's colored blue, commonly used by medical workers and electricians, as well as employees in a technical advisory role.
It's colored green, commonly used by safety officers and inspectors.
It's colored red, commonly used by emergency workers and firefighters.
It's colored pink, commonly issued as a punishment to workers that forgot or lost their hard hat.  Or maybe the previous owner just liked pink.
It's colored grey, commonly used by visitors to any worksite.
It's colored black, like the first real hard hats in history.
It has cartoon character stickers all over it.
It's painted in camouflage dye.
It's colored white and has skull decorations.
It's decorated with an American flag pattern.  Protects your head with the power of freedom.
It's colored black, with industrial gear decorations and a steampunk design.

description: A hard plastic hat worn at construction and industrial sites, with a cloth tucked under it to serve as a makeshift hood.  Makes it a bit more comfortable to wear, and better protects the neck from sun and rain.

pocket_data.description: Pocket for a strapped mandible guard.

variants.description: It's colored yellow, commonly used by general, unspecialized workers like laborers and operators of heavy machinery.
It's colored orange, commonly used by road construction workers, new hires, and site visitors.
It's colored white, commonly used by anyone in a supervisory position, including managers, architects, engineers, and foremen.
It's colored brown, commonly used by workers using applications involving high heat such as welders.
It's colored blue, commonly used by medical workers and electricians, as well as employees in a technical advisory role.
It's colored green, commonly used by safety officers and inspectors.
It's colored red, commonly used by emergency workers and firefighters.
It's colored pink, commonly issued as a punishment to regular workers that forgot or lost their hard hat.  Or maybe the previous owner just liked pink.
It's colored grey, commonly used by visitors to any worksite.
It's colored black, like the first real hard hats in history.
It has cartoon character stickers all over it.
It's painted in camouflage dye.
It's colored white and has skull decorations.
It's decorated with an American flag pattern.  Protects your head with the power of freedom.
It's colored black, with industrial gear decorations and a steampunk design.

description: A red plaid hunting cap with ear flaps.  Notably warm.
A snug-fitting wool hat.  Very warm.
A very comfortable, snug-fitting beanie hat knitted from wool.  Very warm.
A comfortable chullo hat knitted from wool.  It provides warm for the head and ears.
A slouching wool cap with a short front brim, traditionally associated with newspaper delivery boys.  Quite warm.
Padding over your ears, kept in place by some string.  Blocks incoming sounds.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a sombrero, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
//2: Not a real sombrero, but a felt imitation.
description: An orange felt sombrero with traditional white and yellow hand stitching.  The wide brim keeps the sun out of your eyes, and a thin strap hooks around your chin.
A thin, rounded skullcap.  A traditional headdress in Judaism.
A small, crimson skullcap.  Traditionally worn by Catholic priests.
A brimless, short and rounded cap.
A frilly white headpiece.
A flat-topped hat with circular indent and a narrow brim.  Most popular in the 40s and 50s, still common among those in the mod scene, hipsters, and people named Heisenberg.
A stylish narrow-brimmed hat with a sharply indented crown.
A hat with a tall crown and a brim that is turned up on all sides.  It is a traditional Alpine headwear that originated in the Tyrol region of Austria.
A traditional mail carrier's cap, with the US postal service logo embroidered on the front above the plastic brim.  A symbol of a bygone world.
A red hat with white faux fur trim, commonly used by bearded men on Christmas.
A hat woven out of straw.  Its brim helps keep the sun out of your eyes.
A typical hat woven out of straw with a unique weave and lightweight construction.  Its brim helps keep the sun out of your eyes.
A formal summer hat typically made of stiff sennit straw and featuring a flat crown and brim.  It is adorned with a ribbon around the crown.
A sheet of aluminum foil that has been molded into a form-fitting hat.  Perfect for protecting yourself from the government, Illuminati, aliens, and THEM.
A sheet of aluminum foil that has been molded into the shape of a boat that fits the head.  Perfect for protecting yourself from the government, Illuminati, aliens, and THEM.

Some sheets of aluminum foil that had been molded into a form-fitting brimmed hat, just like those ones farmers wear.  Perfect for protecting yourself from the government, Illuminati, aliens, and THEM, with some protection from the sun.
A couple sheets of aluminum foil that had been molded into a form-fitting fedora.  Perfect for protecting yourself from the government, Illuminati, aliens, and THEM, but with STYLE.

A couple sheets of aluminum foil that had been molded into a form-fitting cap that resembles a baseball cap, brim included.  Perfect for protecting yourself from the government, Illuminati, aliens, and THEM, but also with some protection against the sun.
A hat constructed using a single sheet of paper, which was folded and manipulated to form the shape of a boat.
A hat constructed using a single page of newspaper, which was folded and manipulated to form the shape of a boat.

//: No, you're not wearing anything over your top hat.
description: The only hat for a gentleman.  Look exquisite while laughing in the face of danger!

A classic design, the "tricorne", or three-cornered hat, simply pins a large and floppy brim out of the way, though this example adds well-embroidered designs and is oiled against water.  Whether you're the "guvnah" of a settlement, or the captain of a post-apocalyptic crew, this is the hat for you.
Cloth wound around the head, worn by people of many cultures worldwide.  Some historical examples could be huge and ostentatious, but this one is a very simple design.

//: Head encumbrance stops you from wearing additional headgear.  No helmet over a ballcap, sorry.  But brimmed gear gets the anti-glare flag!
description: You're not actually sure if this is called a golf cap, but it's the stereotypical cap golfers wear.

name: wizard hat
description: A blue pointed hat with stars stitched into it.  Wearing it makes you feel like a powerful wizard.

name: pointed hat
description: A pointed hat suitable for a witch.

variants.description: It's colored black.
It's colored dark green.
It's colored dark red.
It's colored dark purple.
